file_content.text: Things have calmed down a lot. You must have really done a number on our predator population.
Every one of those jungle predators you can kill is a big help to this camp.
Useless bureaucrats! Let them come here and do my job for a while....
Uh, forgive me, my lord. I--I didn't see you there.
Sorry for the outburst, sir. Tensions are, uh, running high.
You're a hunter, right? You look like one, anyway.
Excuse me. I was just... going over my orders.
I'm Sergeant Molcarrus, Third Recon Company. Are you here about the bounty on the jungle predators?
Do I look like a bounty hunter to you?
Why would I be?
No. Definitely not, my lord. No offense intended.
You're not terribly insightful are you, little Imperial?
You guess wrongly, fool.
Sorry, my lord. I was hoping someone in your order had heard about our situation.
I'm here on my own business, Sergeant--and it's none of yours.
Don't ask me questions.
Understood, sir. Pardon my mistake.
I don't know what you're talking about, but I'm always for hire.
I could be.
I guess it's lucky you happened to wander through here.
I know nothing about that.
The slaves are being slaughtered, and nobody's doing anything about it.
What's your game, Sergeant?
I'm not selling anything. I'm just trying to fulfill my orders.
I've been in charge of protecting the slaves from predators since my superior was gored by one. There are too many beasts for us to handle.
I requested assistance from Kaas City, but all they did was put a bounty on the jungle creatures, which hasn't helped us at all.
Really?
The only people who responded to the bounty were a pair of Mandalorians who promptly got themselves eaten.
I'm willing to assist.
I'll take any help you're willing to give. I can't do this job with the resources they've given me.
You're flat out of luck.
This isn't about me. I knew what I was signing on for when I took this post.
Poor slaves... I hear their screams when the creatures drag them away. Even offworlders don't deserve to die like that.
The slaves can't do their jobs until these attacks stop. Work at the camp has ground to a halt.
If you could thin out the predator population, it would make a huge difference for us.
Very well.
Anything could happen.
Somebody has to do something.
If you kill the jungle predators, take the proof to Administrator Reese in Kaas City. She's paying the bounties on them.
I think not. [Refuse quest]
I'd better pull together a detail to sweep the jungle around here. Goodbye.
Blasted predators ate two more slaves today. This is getting out of hand!
I'm just saying keep your eyes open. You might come face-to-face with some beasts by accident.
I thought you hunters were always up for a challenge. This jungle is full of chances for you to earn some credits.
Understood, sir. I just hope you'll keep your eyes open while you're in the jungle.
I understand, my lord--but you never know what might happen while you're walking back to civilization.
